visualize_geometry module¶

class visualize_geometry.GeomtryVisualizer(geometry_file, style=None, vizpath='visualize/')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class for visualizing a 3D geometry stored as a h5 file.

The geometry is read from a single h5 file, vtk-compatible subfiles are then generated for each spatial domain and boundary. Users can then specify which domains and boundaries to show in the visualization.

The spatial domains are designated by the following identificators
0: cytosol 1: cleft 2: junctional sr 3: non-junctional sr 4: t-tubule

Methods

create_bbox() Add a bounding box of the entire geometry to the visualization.
create_boundary_actor(key) Create a boundary actor for the given boundary.
create_boundary_actors()
create_domain_actor(domain_id) Initialize a vtk actor for given spatial domain.
create_domain_actors() Set up the actors of the domains that are to be visualized and add them to the renderer.
create_renderer() Set up a vtk renderer.
default_style() Default style to be used if none is given by user.
render() Create vtk-compatible files and vtk objects.
write_boundary_file(key) Write information about the given boundary to a .bnd file.
write_domain_file(domain_id) Creates a .vtk file for the given spatial domain.
create_bbox()[source]¶

Add a bounding box of the entire geometry to the visualization.

create_boundary_actor(key)[source]¶

Create a boundary actor for the given boundary.

Parameters:
  • key – name of boundary
  • color – which color to use
  • labal – boolean, label each ‘voxel’ of the boundary?
create_boundary_actors()[source]¶
create_domain_actor(domain_id)[source]¶

Initialize a vtk actor for given spatial domain.

Parameters:domain_id – which domain to visualize
create_domain_actors()[source]¶

Set up the actors of the domains that are to be visualized and add them to the renderer.

create_renderer()[source]¶

Set up a vtk renderer.

default_style()[source]¶

Default style to be used if none is given by user.

Only jSR, nSR and RyR are shown by default.

render()[source]¶

Create vtk-compatible files and vtk objects.

write_boundary_file(key)[source]¶

Write information about the given boundary to a .bnd file.

The boundary information in the h5 is specified by point-pairs (p1, p2), where the flux points from p1 to p2. We calculate the centerpoint between these and save it to the boundary file alongside which direction the flux points.

Parameters:key – indentifier of the boundary, which is also its key in the h5 file.
write_domain_file(domain_id)[source]¶

Creates a .vtk file for the given spatial domain.

Each point for the given spatial domain is written into a .vtk file along with metadata.

Parameters:domain_id – integer in the range [0, 4].
